intro: Pelecyphora abdita subsp. tenuispina, commonly known as the narrow-spined pelecyphora, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are typically arranged in spikes and are characterized by their tubular shape and vibrant colors. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
